website_summaries.verdict: Taller cyclists will love this carrier for its strong, lightweight construction and how easily it can be removed from its base.
pros: For children ages 1 year and up, weighing up to 40 pounds
Strong, lightweight, polypropylene constructionQuick release harness
Leg restraints and padded cross bar
Bonus seat spring guard and spoke guard
Cross bar is perfect for clipping a toy or sippy cup
cons: Shorter cyclists – those 5 feet 5 inches and under – may not be able to ride with the saddle tall enough to keep the child seat level

customer_reviews.title: Love it! I love riding my bicycle and my ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it! I love riding my bicycle and my kids have been dying to ride with me. This let's us all ride together!
customer_reviews.author: Tangee Moore

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: I love this carrier. It's sturdy and holds my little mans in there just right. I did some macgyver stuff to make it perfect, which was just attaching a shade from a car seat.
customer_reviews.author: HanSoloFoSho

customer_reviews.title: Not for short people with short saddles
customer_reviews.text: The seat is nice and sturdy but if you're short don't buy it. I'm 5'3 and the saddle needed to be about an 1.5 inches taller than I could ride at, to connect to the rack properly, to keep the child seat level and not leaning forward. For anyone about 5'6 and up this is an excellent seat for the price. If you do lots of off roading or dirt roads you may want to consider a seat with shocks or springs. Fit great on my bike if I was tall enough Schwinn Candis women's 26 in. Cruiser.
customer_reviews.author: DaddyJust

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. Put in on in about 20m. Just needed a screwdriver and it was delivered earlier than expected. My son is 4 months at 15lbs and 24 in and he fit just fine. Adjustable straps work great and it's very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Good seat, but beware of balancing it when child is strapped in.
customer_reviews.text: Installation is a little complicated, but the seat seems very sturdy on the bike and my 18 month old daughter loves it. The only concern I have is that my bike definitely does NOT stay stable when she is strapped in unless I am very deliberately steadying it. It's a standard bike with nothing wrong with it and a fine kickstand, but I have to be careful once she is strapped in to not allow the bike to tip over. She weights 26 lbs and unless I'm on the bike or concentrating on balancing it, it would tip over easily.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Life Changing Level of Annoyance
customer_reviews.text: If you want to be pushed mentality to the limit every time you go for a bike ride this seat is for you. Works great after beating the crap out of it to get it on. Give this to someone you hate.
customer_reviews.author: Style Me High

customer_reviews.title: Sweet sweet liberation!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I paid to have it installed while my bike was having a tune-up, so I can't speak to how easy it is to install. It is easy to adjust though, and after a few rides I'm still in love with it. My daughter enjoys it also and she feels well secured in it. It's so liberating to be able to ride again! We put this on my Reid Ladies Vintage Classic (it is sort of a cruiser style bike). I wanted a rear mount so I could keep my basket in front.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca P.

customer_reviews.title: The nap magnet
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this bike seat. It attaches so that it doesn’t bounce with every bump and send my kid flying up and down like other seats do. There are straps that go across the leg opening near their shins that keeps their feet from dropping into the wheels as well. The lap latch and harness system is very easy to use and just adds even more safety to this seat. A great product and such great fun to ride around with my little one. A nap magnet!
customer_reviews.author: Arquette

customer_reviews.title: not for a small frame mountain bike
customer_reviews.text: My son and i were so excited when this came in so he could join mommy on his first bike ride. But when trying to attach the frame to my bike, it won't attach properly. I am 5'5 tall with a small frame size 27inch mountain bike. The way its required to attach to the seat post dosent work. It sits at an angle towards me instead of flat and lays right up onto rubbing against my tire. If I was able to maybe have my seat higher or a bigger frame say a medium maybe it may work but it definitely will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Elissa Olivas

customer_reviews.title: The screws it comes with are junk. DO NOT USE THEM!
customer_reviews.text: The seat itself looks sturdy but the screws it came with to attach the carrier to the bike are JUNK! Please do a favor by getting a new set of screws and throw the screws it came with. While trying to tighten the screws, the thread became dull and it will not allow me to tighten the bolt. Not worth the risk. Get good quality screws from your local bike shop or hardware store and use them to attach the seat to your bike.
customer_reviews.author: Lakshmi Narayana Jammi

customer_reviews.title: THEY THOUGHT OF EVERYTHING!!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this Child Carrier! It's similar to what I used as a child but it is STURDY! The construction is extremely solid and the engineering is fantastic! It took a little over 30 minutes to get installed on the bike and they have so many saftey features, my daughter LOVES IT! The quick detach ability of the seat is great, it's pretty impressive how safe and portable this system is! Schwinn for the win!
customer_reviews.author: Nick and Rachel

customer_reviews.title: GREAT SEAT!! Very sturdy!!
customer_reviews.text: I love love love this seat. It was hard for me to put on my bike . But once I figured it out I was really happy with it. I had another one I got from Walmart but that one would bounce and hit my back tire every time I hit a rock or anything! This is really sturdy and makes me feel like my daughter (15 months old) is safe in it! The cushion for her butt is thick and she seems comfortable when I put her in it. I love that it has a head rest too. Definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Connee

customer_reviews.title: I love this! Very easy to install
customer_reviews.text: I love this! Very easy to install. I actually installed it without instructions but not intentionally. I found the instructions in the back of the headrest inside a plastic bag! How does that make sense to put them there!? Packaged with an accessory piece. The instructions should be inside the lower mounting bracket duh!! I did read over the instructions and double check my work. I wish I would've removed my rear reflector before installing the lower mounting bracket but I will just add one on the back (there's a place for one). All I have left is the spokes protector to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amit&Jenn

customer_reviews.title: it would be perfect, but they don't
customer_reviews.text: I use this with my three year old and the foot cups are already at the bottom and I have to squeeze his feet into them. If they detached, it would be perfect, but they don't. Also, the construction is kind of flimsy. I thought the seat would be a lot more solid, but it's a bit shaky. My son doesn't seem to mind though. He loves it. He wants to go everywhere in the bike seat now. Also, the seat is pretty comfy and my son doesn't mind hitting bumps. I would recommend this seat to anyone with a child under 40lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Pungprakearti

customer_reviews.title: Good basic seat
customer_reviews.text: Got this bike seat to take my 7mo old on rides, so far it works great though I wish it didn’t have to sit so completely upright. It does also fit my 2 yr old and almost 5 year old just fine. My biggest complaint is that the shoulder straps aren’t adjustable so it cuts across my babies neck too jiffy, but I did add pads from a cat seat to help with that.
customer_reviews.author: Nerissa

customer_reviews.title: Super awesome bike Seat!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have no idea how to put it together I didn’t put it together my actual local bike shop did it for me they were super awesome super nice. So I wouldn’t know how it is to put together but it is super handy super fun I love taking my son out for a bike ride and he loves it as well. My son is 17 months and he weighs 28 pounds height 33. I hope this helps someone.
customer_reviews.author: MrsKumar

customer_reviews.title: Great for my son!
customer_reviews.text: I was searching left and right for a good rear-mount bike seat for my son and came across this. Excellent value all around! Installed super easy, straps are simple to adjust and the bike seat is very sturdy. I have no issues with movement etc. The one downside is that my son sits pretty low in relation to me while I’m riding. Almost feels like he’s about to fall out! But of course it’s just an illusion.
customer_reviews.author: TDo

customer_reviews.title: Scary to ride a child on your bike with this
customer_reviews.text: Feels super unsafe to ride a toddler around on this. Lost my balance when I took a (not sharp) turn, going slow. Yikes. I think I need to return it...If I can figure out how to disassemble it. Oof. The seat we have that goes between the handlebars and the adult seat feels so much more secure/ safe for your kid.
customer_reviews.author: Steinman

customer_reviews.title: safe and effective
customer_reviews.text: The safety of our bike seat got put to the test last night when I fell over trying to get off my bike with my 2.5 year old in the seat. We slammed hard on the ground but son was protected and didn’t have a scratch on him. He was wearing a helmet, as well. As far as ease of installation, my husband did the initial install but I found it pretty easy to slide the seat on and off after the mount was installed.
customer_reviews.author: Maura

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: I love riding around with my 18 month old in this bike seat. He loves the view and taking in the air and scenery. I installed most of the seat on my own but had to have my husband help a little. Straps are adjustable and easy to fasten and loosen. The cross bar mostly stays locked as my son is small enough to fit without bringing up and down each ride.
customer_reviews.author: samantha lopez

customer_reviews.title: Seems solid, but the safety bar is a little flimsy
customer_reviews.text: I like this seat in general, and it was easy to install. Seems sturdy and well made, but the safety bar that goes across the child's lap is just a tad on the flimsy side where it locks into place. Overall, I'm satisfied with the seat because I think it's solid and safe overall, but this bar could be a bit sturdier and not rely on a little plastic tab to flex and lock it into place.
customer_reviews.author: Beth

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to remove when not being used.
customer_reviews.text: This child seat comes with a bike rack which holds the seat securely and can also be used as a traditional bike rack to hold items. The rack securely mounts to my 29” mountain bike with plenty of room for the wheel. The child seat is quick and easy to attach to the rack and is very secure. If you want to remove the seat when it not being used, you can do so very quickly and easily. Both rack and seat are made with classic Schwinn quality. Includes rubber pads to protect the frame and seat post from scratches. Will NOT work with a full suspension/rear suspension bike.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Glab

customer_reviews.title: Great bike seat
customer_reviews.text: Great child seat. Easy to install. Secure to baby to sit in. The only gripe I have is the piece of plastic used to block the foot’s contact with the wheels, wish it was a more snug fit as there is still enough room for the foot to get in between.
customer_reviews.author: Ev L

customer_reviews.title: Average bike seat for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install but can be a bit cumbersome on the bike since it requires spoke guards and shield that are awkward. Also, the foot wells are very narrow. My daughter had a hard time fitting her sneakers into them — she’s three and wears normal children’s shoes. Wish it was easier to switch between bikes; it’s time very time consuming to remove and re-install.
customer_reviews.author: Doris P.

customer_reviews.title: It will not fit on the bikes or mountain bikes
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this is not fit three of my bikes it only fits bikes with really small tubes if you have a good bike that requires construction good luck it’s not gonna fit the tubes are too wide. All they had to do was make the bracket a quarter inch longer and it would’ve fit almost every bike port engineering
customer_reviews.author: B. salem

customer_reviews.title: great seat
customer_reviews.text: Works great, easy to use and I feel like my child is safe. I have been using it since my son 5 months old, he couldn't sit on his own but the 5point harness he could safely sit and ride in it. He loves that he can see so much and go for ride. I also like the cusion so he is not bouncing around o hard placstic, and loves to "hang on" to bar in front, also great to clip on a toy or sippy cup. I did purchase hardness pad (one you can get for carsets) I fell like the strap could be harsh on his neck especially when bouncing around on back of the bike.
customer_reviews.author: lmag

customer_reviews.title: Reconsider purchase, poorly manufactured product.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend product, frame is flimsy and barely supports 28 lb child. Frame continued to bend into tire causing rubbing. Unfortunately, like most things made in China, this is just not properly built.
customer_reviews.author: Nina

customer_reviews.title: Well made and fairly simple to install.
customer_reviews.text: It is very sturdy, seems well made and was pretty simple to install. I wish the clamps that go on the frame were just a little wider but I managed and I wish the shield was designed a little different, not a fan of the shoelace attachment but I guess it needs to be that way for universal fittings. All in all, when my 2nd kid is born, I'll buy the exact same one for my wife's bike.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Reinheimer Jr

customer_reviews.title: Easy Installation and Safety Features
customer_reviews.text: Relatively easy to attach to bike. Safety features make me comfortable putting my 18mo old son in the bike seat (26lbs) Instructions weren’t the clearest but the installation still took only about 15 minutes between my husband and I. Highly recommend purchasing...this would fit on many bike styles (unsure about mountain bikes)
customer_reviews.author: CP

customer_reviews.title: my kid loves it
customer_reviews.text: my year and a half old kid loves it, he wants to spend the whole day riding with me
customer_reviews.author: Martin Bermejo

customer_reviews.title: Does fit my fat bike!
customer_reviews.text: I was able to successfully install this on a fat bike, a borealis flume. My flume has 26x4 tires and with some slight bending it straddles the tires without rubbing. The mounts near the rear tire fit strangely due to the flume's rear seat stays: they are not round, but oblong. The seat post on the flume is carbon fiber, so I could not crank it down too tightly; I had to wrap something around the seat post and only snug up the bolts.
customer_reviews.author: FFFF00laz3rb33m

customer_reviews.title: Along for the ride
customer_reviews.text: Not that hard to install. The rear wheel connection did interfere with the chain on one of the gears, so that was disappointing, but it’s ok. It not a vital gear and one I rarely use. Also, our daughter is 18-months and sits low, so the helmet she wears hits the headrest and kinda pushes her head forward. It’d be nice for an indention in the seat to make room for a helmet. But that’s my only 2 criticisms. The seat is comfortable and our daughter has enjoyed the rides. She loves the handle bar and the adjustable footrests, but mainly she just enjoys going along for the ride.
customer_reviews.author: I love Amazon!

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this to use with our 2 yr old on a trip to Mackinac Island and beyond. She loved riding in it so much more than the trailer we have. I slipped getting off the bike once and fell, taking the bike and her with me. It did a great job protecting her. No scratches on it either. It takes a little finesse to get it on and off, but not a big deal. My husband did not have a hard time getting it installed on my bike.
customer_reviews.author: EKP

customer_reviews.title: Terrible installation
customer_reviews.text: So annoyed by the installation. The description says all you need is a Phillips screwdriver. You need a decent adjustable wrench that can get into tight spaces. Also, it didn’t include screws for the headrest as it says it does. If I had to do it again, I’d opt for something easier to install. And they should include a light for the back of the rack like they do with the child seat. So now I have to buy a new light for the back of the rack for when I ride my bike without the carrier.
customer_reviews.author: SKP

customer_reviews.title: Did not Fit No Refund !!!!
customer_reviews.text: Hi unfortunately this didn’t fit my bike I have a beach cruiser and it has a Raul already on it. I sent it back to the Amazon Hub Locker location almost a month and still have not received my refund back :/ very disappointed especially when delivery did take quite a bit it was understandable because of the circumstances.
customer_reviews.author: Krystal Sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for toddler
customer_reviews.text: My very tall 2.5 year old fits perfectly in "her seat", and really enjoys riding in it. We installed it fairly painlessly on my ladies firmstrong beach cruiser within a few minutes. It feels secure, and I have ridden dozens of miles with my daughter safely inside. The only thing I would change about this is the velcro leg straps. I wish there was something a bit more sturdy or enclosed to keep my toddler's legs in so that there wasn't a chance she could kick her leg out near the seat. They do provide cardboard spring covers, so that helps ease my worries. I'm so happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie L

customer_reviews.title: The seat is nice, but the rack is very poorly made
customer_reviews.text: This is getting returned. The seat is nice, but the rack is very poorly made. Some of the nuts stripped as soon as I tried to tighten them. I can't imagine putting a child in this seat. The spoke protector is held on with shoe laces too! Are you kidding me? This was nowhere in the pictures. Do yourself a favor, and spend the extra money on a better brand. You'd think Schwinn would sell a quality item, especially for a child, but this is really disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.text: This has been very useful. I love being able to take my baby out with us when we go biking. My husband installed it in no time. The straps are very secure. I feel my baby is safe riding in it. The seat itself is also very secure and stable with the bike. Good support cushioning inside of seat as well.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Regero

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected and great for the price!
customer_reviews.text: It honestly is very secure and seems like the best option for the price. I have been using with all three of my kids from 1-5 yrs. old and the adjustments work well to accommodate all of them! 3 months later and we have enjoyed this bike seat very much!
customer_reviews.author: A Lee

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2 year old daughter (28 lbs) and she loves going for a ride with me. I have an XS specialized hybrid bike. It was easy to install, and we transferred it to another bike with ease. The spoke guard is a little awkward, I ended up doing without.
customer_reviews.author: whitney

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Kid's Bike Seat!
customer_reviews.text: This was really easy to mount - no issues whatsoever. It is great for my almost 2 year old (who is in the 99+ % for height and weight) as he has plenty of space, and it keeps him from kicking you while riding. He thinks holding onto the handle bar and going fast is so much fun! Also, he can still wear a helmet and there is no worry of him not being able to put his head back - no hunching forward, all is good and comfy!
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Installation is a pain, weak bolts that need to be replaced. Seems to hold up okay after that
customer_reviews.text: Provided bolts are rubbish. They are a non-standard size (so getting a replacement to fit exactly isn't possible) and they are very weak! Tightening bends them and makes them weak -- and I wasn't careful to make sure I wasn't using excessive force. I had to go make an extra trip to get stronger bolts from a hardware shop. Once setup it seems to hold up okay (we've used it only a few times though)
customer_reviews.author: Sarra Patanwala

customer_reviews.title: Pain in the butt, doesn't fit on a normal bike rack
customer_reviews.text: yes it keeps my baby safe but since it's a schwinn i thought it would fit on my schwinn bike, which already had a back rack and everything. No and No. What a pain in the ass it was to try and retrofit it onto my damn bike. Wish i had kept the box because I would have returned it. There should be an adjustable function on this so that it can fit on a normal sized bike rack :(
customer_reviews.author: Ambslynn

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: We’ve used this for several months on 3 different bikes. Comfortable for our kiddo (3 yrs old and 35lb), sturdy on the bike, and light (relative to other carriers) to carry. Would buy again. No complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Really nice bike seat for my 2,5 y.o.
customer_reviews.text: We've been loving this bike seat since the day it came. My 2 years and 8 months old son even falls asleep on it while riding! He must be really conformable! And it's price is great compared to others.
customer_reviews.author: cenk

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I tried this on 2 different bikes and it didn't work on either :-( . By the time I found out it wouldn't work on the second it was to late to return. My daughter would have loved this if it worked.
customer_reviews.author: Kendra

customer_reviews.title: However my 24 month old rides very comfortably in the seat
customer_reviews.text: Husband installed on my bike (not Schwinn brand) so I can't comment to the difficulty on installation. However my 24 month old rides very comfortably in the seat. It is so nice to finally be able to ride again! I have had one fall with her strapped in the seat and the harness held her very securely and she received no injuries! Of course we both wear helmets, which is the only problem I've encountered with this seat. Her helmet pushes forward and down bc of the seat back; so I put a towel roll behind her for more head room.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The Good: seat is very adjustable and fit my bike ...
customer_reviews.text: The Good: seat is very adjustable and fit my bike nicely. I have a step-through upright bike. It was relatively easy to install. Con: My daughter screamed every time she was in this and we would go over a bump (she is a year). I finally figured out that the air inflated seat was pinching and scratching her. Simple fix- I took out the seat and now use a folded towel. This bike seat would be wonderful if it was not for the terrible air inflated cushion. A cozy foam seat would have been way better.
customer_reviews.author: CEG

customer_reviews.title: but my two-year old daughter and three-year old niece both love riding in this
customer_reviews.text: I'm sure there are "nicer" seats on the market, but I have no complaints with this one! I've never tried any other brands, but my two-year old daughter and three-year old niece both love riding in this. I purchased this about two months ago, and so far, so good.
customer_reviews.author: NM05

customer_reviews.title: Very safe and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This seat is built like a tank. My 2 year old is very comfortable in this, and looks forward to riding with me. It mounts very securely to my Cannondale commuter style bike frame.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Porter

customer_reviews.title: Not bad.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad. This is the second seat I have purchased from Amazon. Didn’t like the first one because it would hit my tire when I went over a bump. This seat has a better design although I had to make some modifications so it would not sit so close to my butt.
customer_reviews.author: Debra Skaer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves bike rides
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a best bike carrier for my daughter, to ride as a family. Most of the carriers are like attachment that follows the bike and expensive. This one comes in my budget and feels safe for my kid closer to me. Installation took little bit time but that was one time effort. Once the screws are attached setting and removing the actual seat is so easy. Seat cushion is so good and comfortable. Overall the best.
customer_reviews.author: Veer

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good design. Nice that it has good head support. It has very secure x design harness and a cross bar for safety. I wish there was a cover that would go over the wheel to avoid child's foot getting in spokes of wheel of bike.
customer_reviews.author: ND

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: It’s missing parts so we can’t install it! Otherwise it looks like it would work good. Update: I was able to contact the manufacturer and they sent me the parts it was missing. It was super easy and super quick. It would have been better I’d it hadn’t been missing parts but they helped me really well. My 7 mo loves the seat. I tipped over on the bike and he didn’t budge so he’s safe and comfortable. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Errol

customer_reviews.title: Overall WOULD reccomend
customer_reviews.text: The seat fits well on my hybrid bike. However, the design of the added head rest limits so much space for my little one when she has her helmet on... so she is slumping forward and she has poor posture while she sits in this seat. I think that the added head piece needs to be more flexible to supply room for a helmet. My little girl does not like wearing her helmet because of that. Other than that it is fun and easy to ride with.
customer_reviews.author: Outdoorlove

customer_reviews.title: Some screws weren’t in the box
customer_reviews.text: I gave 4 stars, because the screws for the head piece wasn’t in the package, now we have to find and buy them to be able to have that piece installed. Also ... the seat belt burned a little her neck while she slept in our ride ... next time I’ll put some cover to avoid this Other than that, my girl loves the seat ... and me too
customer_reviews.author: Lienys Delisle

customer_reviews.title: Belt doesn't keep toddler from sliding forward in deep seat, resulting in slumped position
customer_reviews.text: My toddler's butt kept sliding forward in the seat because the seat is too deep for him and the seat belt can't be adjusted to go any further back. He ends up slumped in the seat after a few minutes, which looks very uncomfortable and very bad for his spine. I added a belt by putting it through the holes in the back and strapped it across his lap to prevent him from sliding forward. This worked well, even on a 3 hour long bike ride, but I wish the manufacturers had thought of this.
customer_reviews.author: MommaKat

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Hardly write reviews for products, I am happy with this child bike seat. It is very sturdy and took my husband about 20min to install. My little boy loves bike riding with us. It is exactly what we were looking for. Was hesitant to get a seat that sits in the front of the bike with the worry that it would bump our legs. Totally recommend this product. My boy is 2 years old and he fits in there perfectly. Could probably see him still fitting in it another year
customer_reviews.author: A diaz

customer_reviews.title: Nice, but wouldn't fit Schwinn hybrid
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't fit on my Schwinn hybrid without raising the seat to its highest position, which was impossibly high for me. However, I will say I've gone through several bike seats in an attempt to find one that would work, and this was by far the nicest at this price point. Assembly was easy, and it was very well made. Disappointed I couldn't make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Libby

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Our daughter loves her bike seat!! She is 35 inches tall and she fits well. She probably won't have much longer to fit in it, but this summer we have used it a lot. I have it on the back of a Trek mountain bike. We had our local bike shop install it. My husband had more confidence in them doing it correctly than himself. The shield that goes over the rear wheel was removed immediately because my pedal caught on it the first time I got on the bike. It's a safety hazard on my bike, in my opinion. I have no complaints about this seat, me and my daughter love it.
customer_reviews.author: E. Mahoney

customer_reviews.title: Well constructed and with imporant safety mechanisms that your child deserves.
customer_reviews.text: Having tried first a front child seat without much success (my child didn't like it), I think I've found a practical and safe seat that my child actually enjoys riding in. Overall, the seat seems to be well constructed. The blue and grey padding seems fairly comfortable and the safety features (two locking mechanism) give me some piece of mind. The only thing I couldn't do is to place the spoke guard on the back wheel, but by using the Velcro feet restrains that doesn't seem to be a problem.
customer_reviews.author: FQ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for 1 Year Old!
customer_reviews.text: I have a 29" Diamondback Mountain Bike. Mounting was difficult due to position of Disk brakes but I managed to make it work. I still give it 5 Stars because it is an amazing seat. 12 Month old loved the ride. He even fell asleep once. Easy to adjust foot rests. Easy to get child in/out of seat. Make sure to check out Schwinn helmet!
customer_reviews.author: JediMANda

customer_reviews.title: Is it a Schwinn? With no web site support I don't think so.
customer_reviews.text: Had to build a custom bracket for the bike out of aluminum channel and rivets. The seat bracket has the weird up swing that requires the bike seat to be very high. Also Schwinn is just a name plate on this. You will find no reference to it on any official sources.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Lorenz

customer_reviews.title: Great buy/wish it was sturdier
customer_reviews.text: Great for a used product I'm sure the 200 dollar ones are sturdier and more comfy but I wasn't going to risk buying one of those and my kid not enjoying it. But she loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Colt

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy Child Carrier
customer_reviews.text: My son is only 11 months old and this child seat works great for him. I got it now so he could use it for the next couple of years. His feet don't reach the foot straps yet, but that doesn't matter as they also don't reach anything that could hurt him. The rack it sits on is very easy to install, and sturdy. It takes a couple of times to get good at putting the carrier on the rack but after that it is quick and easy. The seat is also very well padded. I was a little worried about bumpy rides until I saw what he would be sitting on.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Great safety seat
customer_reviews.text: Not super easy to install however it is a great seat for my kid. Have fallen off the bike and he didn’t get a scratch on him. Thankful it is well made and safe. He loves riding in it.
customer_reviews.author: rebekah

customer_reviews.title: It came without an instruction manual...
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing. I'm sure the seat itself is pretty good, but if you can't install it, it's pretty useless. You don't really want to be guessing when it comes to securing your child's seat on the back of a bike. Couldn't find any videos on YouTube or instruction manuals for download so had to contact the manufacturer which was a lot more work than it sounds. Got bounced around from one Schwinn department to another. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rob James

customer_reviews.title: Difficult Installation but Worth the QT
customer_reviews.text: Schwinn didn’t provide the necessary tools (or list what tools were needed) to install the seat which made this installation difficult. It was a two person tedious task 100x more difficult than car seat installation (Team Mom and GrandMa). It feels safe and in the end opportunity to ride with her was worth the time spent on installation.
customer_reviews.author: Jade

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and strong
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install Took a few min to figure out but wasn’t hard Only complaint is the wheel guards are strange and I don’t like their shape/attachment (use shoe laces) But seems safe Our son is too young to use it,but we got excited and bought it anyways
customer_reviews.author: beemor

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit Jamis mountain bike - hits chain
customer_reviews.text: We tried it today and my child loves this seat and i want to love it so much but the part that attaches to the bike hits the bike chain. So I can't use a higher gear. If our local bike shop can't help us come up with a solution we will have to return.
customer_reviews.author: KatnissCa

customer_reviews.title: It's a very sturdy seat though and my child feels very secure in ...
customer_reviews.text: I have a beach cruiser and it doesn't allow me to affix on the back without having my seat tipped up. A very minor issue when riding short rides but very uncomfortable on long ones. It's a very sturdy seat though and my child feels very secure in it. I'm thinking maybe of having my husband jerry rig it to fit the bike but do I really want to risk it? We decided to still keep it because it does fit my husband's bike fairly well but it was a disappointment because we bought it so my 2 year old and I can go out for rides together.
customer_reviews.author: SYM

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bike seat for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: Best bike seat for infants ever, well my daughter is now a toddler (14 months) and this seat is perfect for her. My husband just installed it on our beach cruise and we've already been on several rides. Great product, can't wait to use all summer long!
customer_reviews.author: jkroliko

customer_reviews.title: 5 stars for this chair
customer_reviews.text: This has been the best thing I could have bought my 1 1/2 yr old. For get all the tons of toy and junk I could buy her, she loves this. She loves riding with me on the bike, the chair is amazing, is steady and very secure, highly recommend it. COnfort Im not sure but my litle one has never complaint about it. at first I was afraid, but after the first ride and going slow to make sure nothing was going to happen, now I ride my bike normal with my little one right behind me.
customer_reviews.author: werginn

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe
customer_reviews.text: Good cattier. Love that it comes with its own rack. It comes on and off the rack pretty well. I do wish the pin that held it in place was easier to get off. Also the bar is a little hard to put on. Overall I really like t for the price. It’s sturdy and safe.
customer_reviews.author: Suzy Choi

customer_reviews.title: Bolts cheap! Don’t trust! Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The bolts are cheap, I barely used any force and one Of them cracked before I could even get it tight. I’m hesitant on this ten based off this issue. You would think they would invest in high quality bolts for such an important item to need functional Safety features.
customer_reviews.author: Anonymous

customer_reviews.title: Love this seat.
customer_reviews.text: We love this seat and my daughter looks great in it. I researched a long time which seat to get my infant (8 months old). I wanted her to be safe and comfortable while riding with us. I also wanted her to be able to grow into it. This seat is very comfortable for both of us, her legs do not get in our way and she is happy too.
customer_reviews.author: MARIA ELENA ORTIZ

customer_reviews.title: Safe and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: LOVE this seat. I took a little spill on my big with my son on the back and this seat really protected him. It pretty much cacooned him. My so. Also has no problem sleeping in this. The seat sides on and off very easy if you have to remove it to fit the bike in the car or on the bike rack with other bikes. Definitely worth the buy!
customer_reviews.author: EEMac

customer_reviews.title: Great seat for little ones!
customer_reviews.text: My almost 3 year old is loving his new seat. I bought it at a great price and feel it has a lot of safety features. Very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Shopper

customer_reviews.title: large bike seat
customer_reviews.text: The seat is large and heavy. The seat was easily assembled and attached to my beach cruiser. The only issue I had is that the seat is slightly tilted forward since my bike and seat position is in a lower setting and the bar attachment tilts further downward. This makes the child seat tilt forward. Otherwise my son fits in the seat comfortably. He is about 30 lbs and 35 in tall and has plenty of room in the seat. Overall seat worked as expected.
customer_reviews.author: C Gerber

customer_reviews.title: Good choice!
customer_reviews.text: Not too hard to install, fits/comfortable for our son, still easy to ride our bikes!
customer_reviews.author: Anna G.

customer_reviews.title: Did not fit. Hate instructions
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are terrible. We have a Schwinn bike and this did not fit. I would be forced to bring my seat up a lot and I would not be able to pedal that way. If I installed with my seat low the chair would be facing down. Have to return
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quick and easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to install. Preassembled so it speed up installing.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Pagan

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and comfortable and enjoyed by kids
customer_reviews.text: This is very study and moderately easy to install child seat. My 3 yr old son enjoys riding in this seat, and he wasn’t scared to sit in it. The handle bar is very helpful for the kids to hold on to feel more secured.
customer_reviews.author: Greesh

customer_reviews.title: This is a really nice addition to my bike for taking my toddler son ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really nice addition to my bike for taking my toddler son with me on biking rides. At first I was skeptical if he would even fit into this but once I received it and put it on my bike I had no doubts whatsoever. I did not install it myself but rather got it assembled with my Bike at the Walmart where I got my bike from but it has been really easy to remove it for solo rides. Its sturdy, the straps are perfect for keeping the child safe and the material is sturdy and looks of good quality. All in all great value for the price and lot of fun with my son.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Schwinn child seat does not fit Schwinn cruiser bicycle!
customer_reviews.text: Seat looks great, came missing some parts but did not bother me as they were unimportant to the function of the seat. Had to return it because the seat was built to only fit on the rack that was shipped with it and not on the rack that is already built into the cruiser bicycle. I'm very disappointed that Schwinn would manufacture products that are not compatible with each other.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves it.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves it. I put it on a beach cruiser which I suspected it might not fit, and I was right. But it just took a very simple modification and it works perfectly now. Sure the manufacturer won’t warrant it with modifications, but I feel it’s pretty safe.
customer_reviews.author: JDI

customer_reviews.title: Recommend this seat!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent bike seat for my 18mo. granddaughter! Everything is easily adjustable. She is as snug as can be and loves it! There is also room for growth!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve & Linda

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and safe!
customer_reviews.text: After failed attempts to use the bell mini front carrier and the bell rear carrier on a 26” Schwinn sidewinder women’s bike we tried this and it is perfect with more stability than the other two. Easy to install and is sturdy. This one attaches to the frame for the support unlike others that hang freely and bounce around hitting the rear tire over every bump. Plus when you’re not using the seat you can still use the support as a rack for extra items.
customer_reviews.author: steven urbano

customer_reviews.title: Fits 29" disc
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seat, very easy to install (took me 15 minutes to install), priced really gently and fits my 29" with disc breakes
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Only thing I dislike is the lack of head/neck support. My son always fall asleep while riding & then his head is all over the place & we have to constantly readjust him. No issues with attachment or securing to Trek bike.
customer_reviews.author: TUG1RL

customer_reviews.title: 1 year old loves it
customer_reviews.text: Makes the bike back heavy so hand on bike at all times with kit in it. He only cried when we were done riding so it's safe to assume he loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Daughter loves it!
customer_reviews.text: We looked at a bunch of seats on bikes for our youngest so we could go on longer bike rides. We love this one. We just wish we would have bought it earlier.
customer_reviews.author: RGar

customer_reviews.title: Boooooo
customer_reviews.text: Puts you off balance, I slowly dumped my bike first time out and could barely maintain control. Get the thule child carrier.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this seat!!
customer_reviews.text: I was debating between this seat and one that was a little less in price. I'm super happy that I went with the Schwinn, mainly because you can detach the seat very easily without taking the whole thing apart. (Other cheaper models you have to take the whole thing off when you hook your bike to a car bike rack.) My daughter (who is 2 and 25 pounds) absolutely LOVES riding in the seat! It takes a minute to get used to the weight adjustment (more weight in the back, which probably could cause a fish-tail effect if not careful.) But once you're used to it, its a blast! You won't regret this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SJ

customer_reviews.title: A bit tedious to install
customer_reviews.text: A bit tedious to install. My feet do hit sons feet. Figure it will only get worse as he gets bigger. But I think if I adjust it higher, it may help. Was considering a much more expensive carrier, but this just seemed more protective & gives rider a bar to hold onto.
customer_reviews.author: Nassir Ahmad Barekzi

customer_reviews.title: Working well for our three-year-old.
customer_reviews.text: This looks pretty safe and secure for our three-year-old on my husband’s bike. I don’t think he’ll fit into it next year but it’ll be perfect for this summer and fall! The price was reasonable as well.
customer_reviews.author: Brooke Schmidt

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great product but just be careful you have a bike that does not have a rear suspension to avoid the bolts loosening. Also, a helmet for the child which doesnt have any protruding which will hit the seat. Otherwise, I love this product. My 2 year old son loves it. It seems secure and safe!
customer_reviews.author: Majid Lakhani

customer_reviews.title: Good carrier
customer_reviews.text: I have an 18 month baby who likes bike ride.The child carrier can really handy and whenever I use it, I always feel that my baby is well secured. The installation was quite easy (if you follow the instructions). I now carrier piece that is permanently fastened to the bicycle can also be used to carry other items if the baby seat is not installed. Overall, I am very satisfied with this product, especially knowing that my baby is very excited at every opportunity to go for bike ride
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat
customer_reviews.text: It's really nice. The instructions were not the best but not too difficult. It seems sturdy and my grandson loves it.
customer_reviews.author: EllieNae Designs

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Long lasting!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike carrier. I bought it when my daughter was younger and she is now 6 and still fits in there! It hooks on nicely and it has an extra back fitting for the head when they grow. This has been long lasting and could easily last alot longer. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

product_meta.title: Schwinn Deluxe Bicycle Mounted Child Carrier/Bike Seat For Children, Toddlers, and Kids
product_meta.description: Founded in 1895, Schwinn is an American icon, building some of the best-known and best-loved bicycles of all time. From its very beginning in Chicago, Illinois, the Schwinn mission has been to develop bicycles that allow people to experience the confidence and freedom that comes from riding a bike. Ride with the ease of knowing your child is safe with the Schwinn Deluxe Bicycle Wheel Mounted Child Seat. This frame-mounted rear bike seat is designed for toddlers and children. Thanks to a lightweight, polypropylene construction, children ride safe and comfortable close to mom or dad perched on the rear wheel of an adult bike. Quick-release, five-point harness, leg restraints, and padded cross bar add rider safety while on the road. Assembly is easy on most adult bicycles with the use of only a screwdriver. A seat spring guard and bike spoke guard shields hands from moving bike parts. This child seat is not meant for use with bikes that have rear suspensions. Use only on adult bikes. Rider should wear harness and helmet at all times.
feature_bullets: Enjoy safe family bonding bicycle rides with this deluxe child seat made with lightweight, polypropylene construction
The frame mounted rear bike seat is easily assembled, making getting ready for the next adventure hassle free
The quick release 3 point harness, leg restraints, and padded cross bar offer added safety, while the adjustable footwells and removable headrest provide even more comfort for your little rider
The child seat is vented to prevent wind drag, and your little one will appreciate the custom comfort padding that supports their back and the air cushioned pad that lines the seat
This child seat has a 40 pound maximum weight and is recommended for children 1+

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
